replies.msg: The House of Bourbon (English: /ËˆbÊŠÉ™rbÉ™n/, also UK: /ËˆbÉ”ËrbÉ’n/; French: [buÊbÉ”Ìƒ]; Spanish: Borbón) is a European royal house of French origin, a branch of the Capetian dynasty, the royal House of France. Bourbon kings first ruled France and Navarre in the 16th century. By the 18th century, members of the Spanish Bourbon dynasty held thrones in Spain, Naples, Sicily, and Parma. Spain and Luxembourg currently have monarchs of the House of Bourbon.

quote.msg: åº¶ç³»åˆ†æ”¯

The House of Bourbon (English: /ËˆbÊŠÉ™rbÉ™n/, also UK: /ËˆbÉ”ËrbÉ’n/; French: [buÊbÉ”Ìƒ]; Spanish: Borbón) is a European royal house of French origin, a branch of the Capetian dynasty, the royal House of France. Bourbon kings first ruled France and Navarre in the 16th century. By the 18th century, members of the Spanish Bourbon dynasty held thrones in Spain, Naples, Sicily, and Parma. Spain and Luxembourg currently have monarchs of the House of Bourbon.
